channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MCOMPILER-360] NPE when calculating modulepath with invalid entries
item.project: Maven Compiler Plugin (Moved to GitHub Issues)
item.description:
Trying to migrate an saxon/fop maven project to Java 10.

Added module-info.java, entered all required Automatic names. No compiler failures in Eclipse. Running "mvn -e test" leads to 2 warnings and a maven-compile-plugin error

Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.8.0:compile (default-compile) on project xslt: Execution default-compile of goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.8.0:compile failed. NullPointerException -> [Help 1]

Full output is attached.
item.environment:
Linux 4.9.0-8-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.9.110-3+deb9u4 (2018-08-21) x86_64 GNU/Linux
java version "10.0.2" 2018-07-17
Apache Maven 3.5.4
item.summary: NPE when calculating modulepath with invalid entries

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The fix seems quite simple https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-compiler-plugin/xref/org/apache/maven/plugin/compiler/CompilerMojo.html#L243

Throwable cause = pathException.getValue();

This should be good enough. Do you know which dependency causes this issue? I'd like to have an integration test just to verify the fix.

I can attach the project that caused the exception. It's absolutely free - at least on my part. It's just a wrapper around Saxon that I've written years ago, adapted to newer needs from time to time. I've loaded it to Eclipse Proton with m2e. But it works in the same way if you just run "mvn test" from the command line. I've set the JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS: --add-modules=java.se.ee.

In case this does not work for you (or even if it does), please provide me instruction on how I can use your improved maven-compiler-plugin. I will report the result.

ouch, did you really add those test-dependencies as required modules? You are aware that required modules cannot be excluded (like Maven can)?
Anyway, a clean module descriptor is another topic. I only want a minimized project, only with 1 troubling dependency. Take a look at src/it
I see some relations with MCOMPILER-359 and MCOMPILER-355

Ok, I get the same failure with the attached reduced pom.xml.
Sorry, what is "src/it"?

Just make a fork of https://github.com/apache/maven-compiler-plugin and create an integrationtest under src/it. If you don't change the code and run mvn verify -Prun-its this IT must fail with the NPE. After the fix it should succeed. That's in short how you can provide a complete patch for this issue.

Tried to, but not used to it. Attached you can find a very reduced version of the project that still gives the failure if I do "mvn test". See MCOMPILER-360.tar.gz. I put it under src/it it and ran the test. But it seems that I do not reach my test as others fail before. See mvn-verify-result.txt.

Also mvn verify -Prun-its takes very long. How to concentrate on this issue? Deleting others from src/it? What not to delete?

That test does indeed require a toolchains.xml file on your sytem.
To only run this test, try to add -Dinvoker.test=MCOMPILER-360*

Running mvn verify -Prun-its -Dinvoker.test=MCOMPILER-360 without a toolchain.xml led to with-Dinvoker.txt, as attached.

Never used a toolchain.xml. The default Java on my machine is 10.0.2, Java 1.8.0 is installed, too, but not active. Did I get you right to run mvn verify with Java 1.8.0 while directing the pom.xml of MCOMPILER-360 to use 10.0.2?

Also: I can mvn install 3.8.1-SNAPSHOT, the one from the git repo. Is that one equipped with your patch (as I guessed)? Than the np failure should have been gone if I use 3.8.1-SNAPSHOT in pom.xml of MCOMPILER-360 an run mvn test. Right? Its not.

brychcy opened a new pull request #7: MCOMPILER-360 nullpointer exception
URL: https://github.com/apache/maven-compiler-plugin/pull/7

Simple NPE fix for https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MCOMPILER-360
Actual code written by me is less than 20 lines, remainder ist infra copied from existing tests

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
I've verified that the added test fails without the fix and succeeds with it.

rfscholte closed pull request #7: MCOMPILER-360 nullpointer exception
URL: https://github.com/apache/maven-compiler-plugin/pull/7

This is a PR merged from a forked repository.
As GitHub hides the original diff on merge, it is displayed below for
the sake of provenance:

As this is a foreign pull request (from a fork), the diff is supplied
below (as it won't show otherwise due to GitHub magic):

+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+ xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+ xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/maven-v4_0_0.xsd">
+ <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+ <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins.compiler.it</groupId>
+ <artifactId>mcompiler360</artifactId>
+ <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+ <packaging>pom</packaging>
+
+ <url>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MCOMPILER-360</url>
+
+ <properties>
+ <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
+ </properties>
+
+ <build>
+ <plugins>
+ <plugin>
+ <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
+ <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
+ <version>@project.version@</version>
+ <configuration>
+ <release>9</release>
+ </configuration>
+ </plugin>
+ </plugins>
+ </build>
+
+ <modules>
+ <module>dep360</module>
+ <module>main360</module>
+ </modules>
+
+</project>
diff --git a/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/plugin/compiler/CompilerMojo.java b/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/plugin/compiler/CompilerMojo.java
index 1d3eebf..d4f8b08 100644
— a/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/plugin/compiler/CompilerMojo.java
+++ b/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/plugin/compiler/CompilerMojo.java
@@ -240,7 +240,7 @@ protected void preparePaths( Set<File> sourceFiles )

for ( Entry<File, Exception> pathException : resolvePathsResult.getPathExceptions().entrySet() )
{

  • Throwable cause = pathException.getValue().getCause();
    + Throwable cause = pathException.getValue();
    while ( cause.getCause() != null )
    {
    cause = cause.getCause();

Fixed in 8a6b4cfd1a7e5ef917c91cfe1da9548205e13a6a
Thanks for the patch!

Build failed in Jenkins: Maven TLP » maven-compiler-plugin » master #74

See https://builds.apache.org/job/maven-box/job/maven-compiler-plugin/job/master/74/
Any ETA on a release with the fix?

Does this address https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MCOMPILER-359?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel&focusedCommentId=16651755

?

I built a local snapshot (3.8.1-SNAPSHOT), and it works.
Just waiting for a release to "officially" use it.

I don't think it's a perfect solution, as I get warnings like:

[WARNING] Can't extract module name from jaxws-ri-2.3.1.pom: zip END header not found
[WARNING] Can't extract module name from jaxb-ri-2.4.0-b180830.0438.pom: zip END header not found

Ideally, they should automatically dumped on the classpath instead of failing to be read.

Other than that, it works.
Any idea when this fix will be released?

I'd like to add: This is a showstopper bug for people who want to use Java with modules. Apparently it has been fixed for half a year now, but still no release.

Please, please, pretty-please just release it, so we can make progress on this painful, long and winding road called module adoption.

correct, Hendrik. I am blocked for about a year now, doing no changes to my fop tool. I am eager to get the 3.8.1 version, as the local changes I did to the git version of maven-compiler-plugin did not lead to a successful result. This may be due to that I am not used to doing changes to a maven plugin, or there are more than one problem when it comes to using modules with saxon, fop and Java >8, or the fix does not work es proposed.

Looks like 3.8.1 was released in late April.
I haven't tried it out yet, but hopefully the issue is solved and I can move on to the next "Java with modules"-issue... Fun times!
This project has moved from Jira to GitHub Issues. This issue was migrated to apache/maven-compiler-plugin#561.
